response_parsed.title: Benchmarking CLI Tools Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide will demonstrate how to utilize FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance) web framework for building APIs, to benchmark command-line interface (CLI) tools written in Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI's ability to handle HTTP requests efficiently makes it an excellent choice for creating high-performance CLI interfaces.
Using FastAPI's built-in performance metrics, we can easily measure the execution time of our CLI tools.
We will learn how to create a FastAPI app that serves as a wrapper around our existing CLI tool, enabling us to benchmark it.

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI
app = FastAPI()

@app.get('/{command}')
def {command}(args: str):
    # Your command-line tool logic here
    # Use subprocess or os to call your CLI tool
    # Example: os.system(f'python3 your_cli_tool.py {args}')

version_notes: This guide focuses on Python 3.12+, but FastAPI also supports previous versions.
Ensure you have installed the necessary dependencies using pip install fastapi[all] and uvicorn.
caveats: This approach requires modifying your existing CLI tool to work within a web context. This may not be feasible in all cases.
While FastAPI provides efficient performance metrics, it's essential to understand that the overhead of running a web server should be considered when comparing results with traditional CLI tools.
